namespace.description: Namespace to insert the check into, if different to the namespace the canary is defined, e.g.

icon.description: Icon for overwriting default icon on the dashboard

transformDeleteStrategy.description: Transformed checks have a delete strategy on deletion they can either be marked healthy, unhealthy or left as is

markFailOnEmpty.description: If check or transformation returns empty, that should be marked as failed

dependsOn.description: DependsOn lists the checks that must complete before this one runs

relationships.description:
Relationships defines a way to link the check results to components and configs
using lookup expressions.

path.description:
Path to the artifact on the check runner.
Special paths: /dev/stdout & /dev/stdin

Relationships defines a way to link the check results to components and configs
using lookup expressions.

ignoreRules.description: List of rules which would be omitted from the fetch result

rules.description: Specify one or more Config rule names to filter the results by rule.

complianceTypes.description: Filters the results by compliance. The allowed values are INSUFFICIENT_DATA, NON_COMPLIANT, NOT_APPLICABLE, COMPLIANT

namespace.description: Namespace to insert the check into, if different to the namespace the canary is defined, e.g.

icon.description: Icon for overwriting default icon on the dashboard

transformDeleteStrategy.description: Transformed checks have a delete strategy on deletion they can either be marked healthy, unhealthy or left as is

markFailOnEmpty.description: If check or transformation returns empty, that should be marked as failed

dependsOn.description: DependsOn lists the checks that must complete before this one runs

relationships.description:
Relationships defines a way to link the check results to components and configs
using lookup expressions.

project.description: Name or ID of the Project

thresholdMillis.description: ThresholdMillis the maximum duration of a Run. (Optional)

interval.description: interval (in seconds) to run checks on Deprecated in favor of Schedule

schedule.description:
Schedule to run checks on. Supports all cron expression, example: '30 3-6,20-23 * * *'. For more info about cron expression syntax see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron
Also supports golang duration, can be set as '@every 1m30s' which runs the check every 1 minute and 30 seconds.
If both schedule and interval are empty, the canary will not run

agentSelector.description:
AgentSelector specifies agents that should run this canary.
When populated, the canary will not run locally but copies
will be created for each matched agent.
This also supports prefix/suffix (eu-west-*) and negations (!team-b)

CanarySpec.description: CanarySpec defines the desired state of Canary

relationships.description:
Relationships defines a way to link the check results to components and configs
using lookup expressions.

hidden.description: If set to true, do not display in UI

type.description: The type of component, e.g. service, API, website, library, database, etc.

lifecycle.description: The lifecycle state of the component e.g. production, staging, dev, etc.

lookup.description:
Lookup component definitions from an external source, use the
forEach property to iterate over the results to further enrich each component.

selectors.description: Lookup and associcate other components with this component

configs.description: Lookup and associate config items with this component

summary.description: Summary is the health, incidents, insights & check summary

forEach.description:
Only applies when using lookup, when specified the components and properties
specified under ForEach will be templated using the components returned by the lookup
${.properties} can be used to reference the properties of the component
${.component} can be used to reference the component itself

logs.description: Logs is a list of logs selector for apm-hub.

statusExpr.description:
statusExpr allows defining a cel expression to evaluate the status of a component
based on the summary.

healthExpr.description:
healthExpr allows defining a cel expression to evaluate the health of a component
based on the summary.

ComponentSpec.description: ComponentSpec defines the specification for a component.

field.description: A JSONPath expression to lookup the value in the config

filters.description: Filters is a list of regex filters to apply to the crawled links.

depth.description: Depth is the maximum number of links to follow.

delay.description: Delay is the duration to wait before creating a new request to the matching domains, defaults to 500ms

randomDelay.description: RandomDelay is the extra randomized duration to wait added to Delay before creating a new request, defaults to 100ms

parallelism.description: Parallelism is the number of the maximum allowed concurrent requests, defaults to 2

script.description:
Script can be a inline script or a path to a script that needs to be executed
On windows executed via powershell and in darwin and linux executed using bash

env.description: EnvVars are the environment variables that are accessible to exec processes

checkout.description: Checkout details the git repository that should be mounted to the process

artifacts.description: Artifacts configure the artifacts generated by the check

using lookup expressions.

path.description: Path  to folder or object storage, e.g. `s3://<bucket-name>`,  `gcs://<bucket-name>`, `/path/tp/folder`

recursive.description:
Recursive when set to true will recursively scan the folder to list the files in it.
However, symlinks are simply listed but not traversed.

minAge.description: MinAge the latest object should be older than defined age

maxAge.description: MaxAge the latest object should be younger than defined age

minCount.description: MinCount the minimum number of files inside the searchPath

maxCount.description: MinCount the minimum number of files inside the searchPath

minSize.description: MinSize of the files inside the searchPath

maxSize.description: MaxSize of the files inside the searchPath

properties.description:
Properties are created once the full component tree is created, property lookup functions
can return a map of component name => properties to allow for bulk property lookups
being applied to multiple components in the tree

query.description: Query to be executed. Please see https://github.com/askgitdev/askgit for more details regarding syntax

GitHubCheck.description:
GitHubCheck executes SQL queries against GitHub repositories using mergestat.

thresholdMillis.description: Maximum duration in milliseconds for the HTTP request. It will fail the check if it takes longer.

responseCodes.description: Expected response codes for the HTTP Request.

responseContent.description: Exact response content expected to be returned by the endpoint.

responseJSONContent.description: Deprecated, use expr and jsonpath function

maxSSLExpiry.description: Maximum number of days until the SSL Certificate expires.

method.description: Method to use - defaults to GET

ntlm.description: NTLM when set to true will do authentication using NTLM v1 protocol

ntlmv2.description: NTLM when set to true will do authentication using NTLM v2 protocol

headers.description: Header fields to be used in the query

env.description: EnvVars are the environment variables that are accessible to templated body

oauth2.description: Oauth2 Configuration. The client ID & Client secret should go to username & password respectively.

jmx.description: Jmx defines the ConfigMap or Secret reference to get the JMX test plan

host.description: Host is the server against which test plan needs to be executed

port.description: Port on which the server is running

properties.description: Properties defines the local Jmeter properties

systemProperties.description: SystemProperties defines the java system property

responseDuration.description: ResponseDuration under which the all the test should pass

Relationships defines a way to link the check results to components and configs
using lookup expressions.

timeout.description: Timeout in minutes to wait for specified container to finish its job. Defaults to 5 minutes

artifacts.description: Artifacts configure the artifacts generated by the check

namespace.description: Namespace to insert the check into, if different to the namespace the canary is defined, e.g.

icon.description: Icon for overwriting default icon on the dashboard

transformDeleteStrategy.description: Transformed checks have a delete strategy on deletion they can either be marked healthy, unhealthy or left as is

markFailOnEmpty.description: If check or transformation returns empty, that should be marked as failed

dependsOn.description: DependsOn lists the checks that must complete before this one runs

relationships.description:
Relationships defines a way to link the check results to components and configs
using lookup expressions.

namespaceSelector.description:
Namespace specifies which namespace(s) to search for resources.
Use empty ResourceSelector to search in canary's namespace.

resource.description: Resource specifies which resources to select by name, labels, or field selectors.

ignore.description:
Ignore specifies resources to exclude from the fetched results.
Values can be glob patterns (e.g., "kube-*", "*-system").

kind.description:
Kind is the Kubernetes resource Kind to check (e.g., "Pod", "Deployment", "Service").
This is a required field.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion is the Kubernetes API version for the resource (e.g., "v1", "apps/v1", "serving.knative.dev/v1").
Used to distinguish between resources with the same Kind but different API groups.

healthy.description: Healthy when true, fails the check if any resources are unhealthy.

ready.description: Ready when true, fails the check if any resources are not ready.

namespace.description: Namespace to insert the check into, if different to the namespace the canary is defined, e.g.

icon.description: Icon for overwriting default icon on the dashboard

transformDeleteStrategy.description: Transformed checks have a delete strategy on deletion they can either be marked healthy, unhealthy or left as is

markFailOnEmpty.description: If check or transformation returns empty, that should be marked as failed

dependsOn.description: DependsOn lists the checks that must complete before this one runs

relationships.description:
Relationships defines a way to link the check results to components and configs
using lookup expressions.

staticResources.description:
StaticResources are kubernetes resources that are created & only
cleared when the canary is deleted

resources.description:
Resources are kubernetes resources that are created & cleared
after every check run.

checks.description: Checks to run against the kubernetes resources.

checkRetries.description: Set initial delays and retry intervals for checks.

clearResources.description: Ensure that the resources are deleted before creating them.

expr.description:
Expr is a cel expression that determines whether all the resources
are in their desired state before running checks on them.
	Default: `dyn(resources).all(r, k8s.isHealthy(r))`

disable.description: Disable waiting for resources to get to their desired state.

delete.description: Whether to wait for deletion or not

timeout.description:
Timeout to wait for all static & non-static resources to be ready.
	Default: 10m

interval.description:
Interval to check if all static & non-static resources are ready.
	Default: 5s
interval (in seconds) to run checks on Deprecated in favor of Schedule

schedule.description:
Schedule to run checks on. Supports all cron expression, example: '30 3-6,20-23 * * *'. For more info about cron expression syntax see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron
Also supports golang duration, can be set as '@every 1m30s' which runs the check every 1 minute and 30 seconds.
If both schedule and interval are empty, the canary will not run

agentSelector.description:
AgentSelector specifies agents that should run this canary.
When populated, the canary will not run locally but copies
will be created for each matched agent.
This also supports prefix/suffix (eu-west-*) and negations (!team-b)

KubernetesResourceChecks.description:
KubernetesResourceChecks is the canary spec.
NOTE: It's only created to make crd generation possible.
embedding CanarySpec into KubernetesResourceCheck.checks
directly generates an invalid crd.

connection.description: Name of the connection used to derive restic password.

awsConnectionName.description: Name of the AWS connection used to derive the access key and secret key.

repository.description: Repository The restic repository path eg: rest:https://user:pass@host:8000/ or rest:https://host:8000/ or s3:s3.amazonaws.com/bucket_name

checkIntegrity.description: CheckIntegrity when enabled will check the Integrity and consistency of the restic reposiotry

accessKey.description: AccessKey access key id for connection with aws s3, minio, wasabi, alibaba oss

secretKey.description: SecretKey secret access key for connection with aws s3, minio, wasabi, alibaba oss

caCert.description: CaCert path to the root cert. In case of self-signed certificates

using lookup expressions.

insecureSkipVerify.description:
InsecureSkipVerify controls whether a client verifies the server's
certificate chain and host name

ca.description: PEM encoded certificate of the CA to verify the server certificate

healthExpr.description:
statusExpr allows defining a cel expression to evaluate the status of a component
based on the summary.

statusExpr.description:
statusExpr allows defining a cel expression to evaluate the status of a component
based on the summary.

properties.description:
Properties are created once the full component tree is created, property lookup functions
can return a map of coomponent name => properties to allow for bulk property lookups
being applied to multiple components in the tree

configs.description: Lookup and associate config items with this component

groupBy.description:
Specify the catalog tag (& optionally the tag selector) to group
the topology.

push.description: Agent will push topology to specified path

fieldRef.description:
Selects a field of the pod: supports metadata.name, metadata.namespace, metadata.labels, metadata.annotations,
spec.nodeName, spec.serviceAccountName, status.hostIP, status.podIP, status.podIPs.
+optional

configMapKeyRef.description:
Selects a key of a ConfigMap.
+optional

secretKeyRef.description:
Selects a key of a secret in the pod's namespace
+optional

VarSource.description: VarSource represents a source for a value

namespace.description: Namespace to insert the check into, if different to the namespace the canary is defined, e.g.

icon.description: Icon for overwriting default icon on the dashboard

transformDeleteStrategy.description: Transformed checks have a delete strategy on deletion they can either be marked healthy, unhealthy or left as is

markFailOnEmpty.description: If check or transformation returns empty, that should be marked as failed

dependsOn.description: DependsOn lists the checks that must complete before this one runs

relationships.description:
Relationships defines a way to link the check results to components and configs
using lookup expressions.

token.description: Token is an optional authorization token to run this check
